message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SD 

The paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques to classify troll and genuine tweets. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also discusses the sociolinguistic limitations of troll writing, which can be seen as a social media phenomenon, making cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) another likely category. The use of machine learning algorithms and regression analysis also suggests cs.LG (Machine Learning) as a possible category. The paper also discusses the distributional anomalies in the language parameters of troll messages, which can be seen as a form of data analysis, making cs.CY (Computers and Society) another possible category. Finally, the paper deals with the classification of tweets, which can be seen as a form of data mining, making cs.SD (Software Engineering) a possible category as well.
